children: A 50-year-old man is evaluated for a 2-day history of fever, malaise, and heart murmur. Today, crops of
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Infective endocarditis is most likely associated with the skin findings shown. Janeway lesions are nonpainful, macular (occasionally nodular), blanching lesions located on the palms of the hands and soles of the feet; they are associated with infective endocarditis.

objective.__html: Diagnose Janeway lesions and recognize their association with infective endocarditis.
